choices.D: Legal compliance regulations and acceptable usage policies
choices.B: Cipher documentation supported by the endpoint operating system

Selected Answer: B
Answer is B
PAN-DB URL category in URL Filtering profile. does that mean predefined URL profile ?

Selected Answer: B
See comments below.

Selected Answer: B
Addt info from PAN (B is correct): 

Precedence for URL filtering 
==========================
Block list
 - Manually entered blocked URLs
Allow list
 - Manually entered allowed URLs
Custom Categories
 - User-defined Custom URL Categories 
Cached
 - Cached = URLs learned from External Dynamic Lists (EDLs) 
Pre-Defined Categories
 - PAN-DB or Brightcloud "canned" / "out of the box" categories.

https://live.paloaltonetworks.com/t5/general-topics/understanding-url-filtering-order-url-filtering-precedence/td-p/238682

Correct answer is B
The priority for URL filtering is:
1. block list
2. allow list
3.custom categories
4.cached
5.pre-defined categories
https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000ClsmCAC

Selected Answer: B
B as ms101 and confusion

Selected Answer: B
B
mz101's link says:
"
block list
allow list
custom categories
cached
pre-defined categories
"

B should be the answer:
https://knowledgebase.paloaltonetworks.com/KCSArticleDetail?id=kA10g000000ClsmCAC
D is not correct, because security policy is checked "before" any security profiles, including URL filtering profile.

choices.A: Custom URL category in URL Filtering profile
choices.B: PAN-DB URL category in URL Filtering profile
choices.D: Custom URL category in Security policy rule

questions.question_text: How should an administrator enable the Advance Routing Engine on a Palo Alto Networks firewall?

choices.C: Enable Advanced Routing in Network > Virtual Routers > Redistribution Profiles and then commit.
choices.B: Enable Advanced Routing Engine in Device > Setup > Session > Session Settings, then commit and reboot.
choices.D: Enable Advanced Routing in Network > Virtual Routers > Router Settings > General, then commit and reboot.
choices.A: Enable Advanced Routing in General Settings of Device > Setup > Management, then commit and reboot.

comments.content: Your next-generation firewall can leverage one or more Palo Alto Networks cloud services. To do this, you must install a device certificate to successfully authenticate the firewall with the Palo Alto Networks Customer Support Portal (CSP) to leverage these cloud services. The circumstances under which a device certificate is required will differ from feature to feature, so install a device certificate only if the feature's setup documentation tells you that this needs to be done.
